title: Arsenal Laia Codina is in Spain Women 26 - player squad , but will she make the cut for the Olympics ?
body_text:
Arsenal Womenâ€™s Kyra Cooney-Cross, Steph Catley, and Caitlin Foord will represent Australia Womenâ€™s team, the Matildas, at the Paris Olympics 2024. Emma Hayes has included Arsenalâ€™s Emily Fox in her USA womenâ€™s team (USWNT) squad for the Olympics.
Aside from these four, another Gunner Women standout player is likely to make her countryâ€™s Olympic team. According to Spain Womenâ€™s X page, Laia Codina is part of their preliminary 26-player squad for the Olympics this summer. Spain will have to cut eight players from its final team for the tournament, which begins on July 25th. We hope that the final selection will include our defender.

Last summer, Codina played a key role in Spain winning the FIFA Womenâ€™s World Cup 2023, appearing in all of the knockout games as well as the final 1-0 win over Englandâ€™s Lionesses to eventually raise the World Cup.
High expectations greeted Codinaâ€™s move to Arsenal, but her assimilation into the Arsenal culture and injuries hindered her progress. Only in the second half of the season did we see glimpses of her talent.
Being chosen to play in the Olympics will be fantastic, not only because she could win an Olympic gold medal but also because she will be able to gain momentum heading into next season for our Gunners. We need Codina to arrive sharp and fired up to help Arsenal Women qualify for next seasons Womenâ€™s Champions League football, and get off to a good start in the WSL 2024â€“25.
What are your thoughts Gooners?
